import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from statsmodels.tsa.arima.model import ARIMA
from statsmodels.tsa.stattools import adfuller
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv('Landsat-8-and-9-SR-Bands-1-7-L08-002-results.csv')[['Date']]
df['Date'] = pd.to_datetime(df['Date'])
df = df.dropna(subset=['Date'])
df.set_index('Date', inplace=True)
df

source:
from statsmodels.tsa.arima.model import ARIMA

# Define the ARIMA model (replace p, d, q with your selected values)
model = ARIMA(daily_passovers, order=(p, d, q))
model_fit = model.fit()

# Print model summary
print(model_fit.summary())

result = adfuller(df.index.to_series())
print('ADF Statistic:', result[0])
print('p-value:', result[1])

since the augmented dickey-fuller test (adf) has a p-value of 1.0 > 0.05, we have insufficient evidence to reject the null hypothesis that the series is non-stationary

thus, we differentiate:

source:
p = 1
d = 1
q = 1

model = ARIMA(df_diff, order=(p, d, q))
model_fit = model.fit()
forecast = model_fit.forecast(steps=1)
predicted_date = df.index[-1] + pd.Timedelta(days=forecast[0])
print("Predicted next date:", predicted_date)

plt.figure(figsize=(10, 5))
plt.plot(df.index, df.values, label='Historical Data')
plt.axvline(x=predicted_date, color='r', linestyle='--', label='Predicted Next Date')
plt.legend()
plt.title('Date Prediction using ARIMA')
plt.xlabel('Date')
plt.ylabel('Value')
plt.show()
